event: Early settlements by Ciboney peoples, followed by Arawaks and later Caribs.
Christopher Columbus sights the islands on his second voyage.
English establish first settlement on Saint Kitts.
French establish colony on Saint Kitts alongside the English.
Carib population massacred by Europeans during joint Anglo-French operation.
First English settlement established on Nevis.
Treaty of Breda confirms English control over Saint Kitts.
Treaty of Paris confirms British control over both Saint Kitts and Nevis.
Slavery abolished in the British Empire; emancipation of enslaved Africans.
Saint Kitts, Nevis, and Anguilla united as a single British colony.
Becomes an associated state with internal self-government.
Anguilla formally separates from Saint Kitts and Nevis.
Saint Kitts and Nevis gains full independence from the United Kingdom on September 19.
Referendum on Nevis independence fails to reach required two-thirds majority.
Closure of the sugar industry, which had been central to the economy for centuries.
Timothy Harris becomes Prime Minister following general elections.
Government implements lockdowns and economic aid during COVID-19 pandemic.
